text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd. may start monetising this year, as it plans to soon start aggressively pushing the Jio phone in the market.That’s the word coming from brokerage CLSA, as it along with peers maintained a bullish stance on parent company Reliance Industries Ltd. and raised their target prices. They see an uptick of up to 26 percent in the stock price, as the company managed to meet analysts estimates and Jio turning profitable within 15 months of launch.The telecom operator has confirmed that its home broadband as well as enterprise businesses should launch in the coming months, while Reliance Jio is actively looking at ways of monetising its content apps, CLSA said in a report.Here’s what brokerages had to say about Reliance Industries post Q3 results:
title: What Dalal Street Made Of Reliance Industries’ Q3 Performance
